abstract: Spanish engineering company Actividades de Construccion y Servicios (A.C.S.) said Wednesday that it will sell a stake in Abertis Infraestructuras to CVC Capital Partners, The Wall Street Journal reported. The deal values the highway operator at more than 11 billion euros ($14.3 billion).
snippet: Spanish engineering company Actividades de Construccion y Servicios (A.C.S.) said Wednesday that it will sell a stake in Abertis Infraestructuras to CVC Capital Partners, The Wall Street Journal reported. The deal values the highway operator at mo...
lead_paragraph: Actividades de Construcción y Servicios (A.C.S.), Spain’s largest construction company, said Wednesday that it would sell a stake in Abertis Infraestructuras to CVC Capital Partners, The Wall Street Journal reported. The deal values Albertis, a highway and parking lot operator, at more than 11 billion euros ($14.3 billion).

headline.main: CVC to Acquire A.C.S.’s Stake in Abertis
